I wanted someone local who has been in business at least 10 years, not a fly-by-night company
The warranty was huge - 50 years on materials AND workmanship, not just materials
They showed me examples of their work in my actual neighborhood
The salesperson wasn't pushy and actually educated me about what I needed
They handle all the insurance paperwork and deal with the adjuster for me
I could get references from neighbors who used them years ago and were still happy
They use their own crews, not subcontractors, so there's accountability
The online reviews were consistently good over many years, not just recent
They offered financing with reasonable terms so I didn't have to drain my savings

Minimal transparency around pricing - most require contact for quote, creating barrier for researchers
Lack of content comparing different roofing materials for specific climates/situations in educational rather than sales tone
Limited behind-the-scenes content showing crew training, safety protocols, quality control
Few contractors address the 'repair vs replace' decision with objective criteria
Gap in content for real estate agents and home inspectors (B2B referral sources)
Limited use of customer success stories focused on specific pain points rather than generic testimonials

SUBJECT: Is your roof trying to tell you something? [5 warning signs]
PREVIEW: What starts as $500 becomes $15,000. Here's the timeline...

---

Hi [FIRST_NAME],

PROBLEM:
Your roof shows warning signs 6-12 months BEFORE you see water stains on your ceiling. By the time you notice the stain, the average repair cost has jumped from $500 to $15,000.

I'm sharing this because we just completed a $22,000 structural repair for a homeowner who waited 18 months. It could have been a $400 shingle replacement.

AGITATE:
Here's the timeline of what happens when you ignore the warning signs:

‚Ä¢ Month 1-2: Small leak (invisible) - $500 fix
